coulomb_example

Example script demonstrating the alternative Coulomb module.

This script shows how to use the alt_coulomb module to calculate Coulomb interactions in a quantum wire system. It includes examples of: - Setting up system parameters - Creating momentum grids - Calculating screened potentials - Computing collision rates - Analyzing results

Author: AI Assistant Date: 2024

Functions

create_gaas_quantum_wire()

Create a GaAs quantum wire system with realistic parameters.

create_momentum_grid_1d([N, k_max])

Create a 1D momentum grid for quantum wire calculations.

calculate_energy_dispersions(ky, me, mh)

Calculate parabolic energy dispersions for electrons and holes.

create_thermal_populations(ky, Ee, Eh[, T, mu_e, mu_h])

Create thermal carrier populations using Fermi-Dirac statistics.

main()

Main example function.

create_plots(grid, Ee, Eh, ne, nh, Veh, Vee, Vhh, Win, ...)

Create visualization plots of the results.

performance_benchmark()

Benchmark the performance of Coulomb calculations.
